C1_School closing.1: Recommend closing or all schools open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non-Covid-19 operations
C1_School closing.2: Require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools)

C2_Workplace closing.1: Recommend closing (or recommend work from home)
C2_Workplace closing.2: Require closing (or work from home) for some sectors or categories of workers
C2_Workplace closing.3: Require closing (or work from home) for all-but-essential workplaces (eg grocery stores, doctors)

C4_Restrictions on gatherings.1: Restrictions on very large gatherings (the limit is above 1000 people)
C4_Restrictions on gatherings.4: Restrictions on gatherings of 10 people or less

C5_Close public transport.1: Recommend closing (or significantly reduce volume/route/means of transport available)
C5_Close public transport.2: Require closing (or prohibit most citizens from using it)

C6_Stay at home requirements.2: Require not leaving house with exceptions for daily exercise, grocery shopping, and 'essential' trips
C6_Stay at home requirements.3: Require not leaving house with minimal exceptions (eg allowed to leave once a week, or only one person can leave at a time, etc)

C7_Restrictions on internal movement.1: Recommend not to travel between regions/cities

C8_International travel controls.2: Quarantine arrivals from some or all regions
C8_International travel controls.4: Ban on all regions or total border closure

H1_Public information campaigns.1: Public officials urging caution about Covid-19
H1_Public information campaigns.2: Coordinated public information campaign (eg across traditional and social media)

H2_Testing policy.1: Only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas)
H2_Testing policy.2: Testing of anyone showing Covid-19 symptoms
H2_Testing policy.3: Open public testing (eg 'drive through' testing available to asymptomatic people)

H3_Contact tracing.1: limited contact tracing; not done for all cases
H3_Contact tracing.2: comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases

H6_Facial Coverings.2: Required in some specified shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present, or some situations when social distancing not possible
H6_Facial Coverings.3: Required in all shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present or all situations when social distancing not possible
H6_Facial Coverings.4: Required outside the home at all times regardless of location or presence of other people

E1_Income support.1: Government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary)
E1_Income support.2: Government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary)

E2_Debt/contract relief.1: Narrow relief, specific to one kind of contract
